newsitem.title: USA: J.P. Morgan to merge asset management -WSJ.
newsitem.headline: J.P. Morgan to merge asset management -WSJ.

text.p: J.P. Morgan & Co is merging its private-client asset management business with its investment management business, which manages about $160 billion in institutional assets, the Wall Street Journal said in Thursday's electronic edition.
The newspaper said the move was announced in an internal memo from J.P. Morgan chairman Douglas Warner III to the bank's employees this week.
Ramon de Oliveira, head of the bank's stock-underwriting unit, would lead the asset-management services group, the newspaper said.
The private-client business managed $50 billion in assets, the newspaper said.

The Journal quoted Warner as saying in the internal memo the move was caused by "fundamental changes in the management of retirement assets (that) are blurring distinctions between investment management for institutions and individuals."
